Paragraph: 1,4 Recently , power conversion efficiency higher than 7% for BHJ polymer solar cells has been achieved by several groups through the developing of new polymer donor materials with the use of [6,6]-phenyl-C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC61BM ) or [6,6]phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as electron acceptors.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC61BM) |
| [6,6]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM) |

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the updated table with the valid entities that clearly refer to "Material name" in the paragraph:

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

I apologize for the mistake in my previous response. Here are the valid entities that refer to material properties in the given paragraph, presented as a Markdown table:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| power conversion efficiency |
| electron acceptors |

Note that "power conversion efficiency" and "electron acceptors" are the only entities in the paragraph that clearly refer to material properties. The other entities mentioned, such as "BHJ polymer solar cells" and "butyric acid methyl ester," are not directly related to material properties and were therefore excluded from the table.
